verses.roman:
brahma, ātmā, bhagavān--anuvāda tina
aṅga-prabhā, aṁśa, svarūpa--tina vidheya-cihna

synonyms: brahma—the impersonal Brahman; ātmā—the localized Paramātmā; bhagavān—the Personality of Godhead; anuvāda—subjects; tina—three; aṅga-prabhā—bodily effulgence; aṁśa—partial manifestation; svarūpa—original form; tina—three; vidheya-cihna—predicates.
translation: Impersonal Brahman, localized Paramātmā and the Personality of Godhead are three subjects, and the glowing effulgence, the partial manifestation and the original form are their three respective predicates.
